laboratory_examinations.findings: Aortic annulus of 7.4 mm with mild aortic insufficiency, a dilated aortic root (11 mm), and ascending aortic aneurysm (11 mm). Normal-sized aortic arch and descending aorta. Dilated pulmonary trunk (11 mm).

Extreme arterial tortuosity involving the aortic arch, supra-aortic trunks, pulmonary branches, and descending aorta. Dilation of the aneurysm had progressed (ascending aorta 27 mm; aortic root 22 mm).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Dilation of the aneurysm progressed from 11 mm (ascending aorta) to 27 mm, and from 11 mm (aortic root) to 22 mm.
